<span id="top"></span>

Yeamin Faria Chowdhury is a geospatial scientist specializing in wildlife ecology, remote sensing, and spatial data science. She earned a PhD in Geospatial Information Sciences from The University of Texas at Dallas, USA. Her dissertation used camera-trap, environmental, and anthropogenic data to study mammal behavior and predatorâ€“prey dynamics in Guyana. She develops machine learning workflows in Python, R, and ArcGIS. She has teaching experience in GIS and analytics, and has received the 2024â€“25 Pioneer Student Research Grant and the 2025 GIS Outstanding Teaching Assistant Award.  

**Education:**  
PhD in Geospatial Information Sciences	(August 2025). [The University of Texas at Dallas](https://www.utdallas.edu/), Texas, USA.

Master of Science in Environmental Sciences	(December 2019) 
[Jahangirnagar University](https://juniv.edu/), Savar, Bangladesh.
